intro: Dimorphanthes crispa, commonly known as the crested dimorphanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, crinkled leaves and showy, yellow flowers with prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or near water bodies. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
